title: Generate a rdf:List as an object
purpose: Tests if a rdf:List is generated as an object

title: Generate a rdf:Bag as an object
purpose: Tests if a rdf:Bag is generated as an object

title: Generate a rdf:Seq as an object
purpose: Tests if a rdf:Seq is generated as an object

title: Generate a rdf:Alt as an object
purpose: Tests if a rdf:Alt is generated as an object

title: Generate a named rdf:List as an object
purpose: Tests if a named rdf:List is generated as an object

title: Generate a named rdf:Bag as an object
purpose: Tests if a named rdf:Bag is generated as an object
comment: If it works for bags, then it should work for sequences and alternatives.

title: Allow the generation of empty lists
purpose: Tests if the use of rml:allowEmptyListAndContainer yields an empty list.

title: Allow the generation of empty lists identified by blank node identifiers.
purpose: Tests if the use of rml:allowEmptyListAndContainer yields an empty list. The lists are identified by a blank node identifier generated in the mapping.

title: Allow the generation of empty lists identified by IRIs.
purpose: Tests if the use of rml:allowEmptyListAndContainer yields an empty list. The lists are identified by a IRI generated in the mapping.

title: Empty lists are not generated
purpose: Tests if empty lists are not generated (expected default behavior).

title: Empty lists are not generated II
purpose: Tests if empty lists are not generated (expected default behavior). This test cases uses the predicate rml:allowEmptyListAndContainer.

title: Allow the generation of empty bags
purpose: Tests if the use of rml:allowEmptyListAndContainer yields an empty bag.
comment: If it works for bags, then it should work for sequences and alternatives.

title: Empty bags are not generated
purpose: Tests if empty containers are not generated (expected default behavior).

title: GatherMap in subject map (list)
purpose: Tests if the use of a gather map in the subject map is supported. This test generates a list.

title: GatherMap in subject map (list)
purpose: Tests if the use of a gather map in the subject map is supported. This test has no predicate-object maps and no class declarations in the subject map. It still needs to generate triples as the lists consists of at least one cons-pair.

title: GatherMap in subject map (list)
purpose: Tests if the use of a gather map in the subject map is supported. This test has no predicate-object maps and no class declarations in the subject map. Only one list needs to be generated as the other has no values and we only retain non-empty lists.

title: GatherMap in subject map (bag)
purpose: Tests if the use of a gather map in the subject map is supported. This test generates a bag.

title: GatherMap in subject map (bag)
purpose: Tests if the use of a gather map in the subject map is supported. This test has no predicate-object maps and no class declarations in the subject map. It should generate a non-empty bag and an empty bag. The reason being that a container has at least one triple ; it's type (bag, seq, or alt).

title: Append values of multiple term maps
purpose: Tests appending of values from multiple term maps in an gather map. This test covers the case where all sets of values are non-empty.

title: Append values of multiple term maps
purpose: Tests appending of values from multiple term maps in an iteration. In this example, one of the arrays is empty and the expected behavior is to concatinate a list with the empty list.

title: Cartesian product of values from multiple term maps of a gather map.
purpose: Tests generating the Cartesian product of values from multiple term maps in a gather map. This test covers the case where all sets of values are non-empty.

title: Cartesian product of values from multiple term maps of a gather map.
purpose: Tests generating the Cartesian product of values from multiple term maps in a gather map. This test covers the case where one of the sets is empty. The Cartesian product of a set with an empty set is empty. This entry should thus not yield a list.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a collection.
purpose: When no template, constant, or reference is given to a gather map, then each iteration yields a different collection.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a collection.
purpose: When using a template, constant, or reference for a gather map, this tests determines whether the values are correctly appended to the list. The natural order of the term maps inside the gather map as well as the iteration are respected. This test covers one term map in the gather map.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a collection.
purpose: When using a template, constant, or reference for a gather map, this tests determines whether the values are correctly appended to the list. The natural order of the term maps inside the gather map as well as the iteration are respected. This test covers two term maps in the gather map.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a container.
purpose: When no template, constant, or reference is given to a gather map, then each iteration yields a different container.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a container.
purpose: When using a template, constant, or reference for a gather map, this tests determines whether the values are correctly appended to the container. The natural order of the term maps inside the gather map as well as the iteration are respected. This test covers one term map in the gather map.

title: Gather values across iterations to create a container.
purpose: When using a template, constant, or reference for a gather map, this tests determines whether the values are correctly appended to the container. The natural order of the term maps inside the gather map as well as the iteration are respected. This test covers two term maps in the gather map.

title: Nested gather maps
purpose: Testing whether nested gather maps are created. The mapping should generate a list of bags.

title: Elements via reference object-map.
purpose: Testing whether gather maps generate an RDF list whose members are generated by a referencing object-map.

title: Elements via reference object-map with default join condition
purpose: Testing whether gather maps generate an RDF list whose members are generated by a referencing object-map with a default join condition.

title: Gather duplicate values in an RDF Bag
purpose: Testing the expected behavior of multi-valued expression maps containing duplicate values when these expression maps are used in a gather map to create an RDF Bag.

title: Gather duplicate values in an RDF List
purpose: Testing the expected behavior of multi-valued expression maps containing duplicate values when these expression maps are used in a gather map to create a list.

title: Combining graph maps and gather maps (graph map has a template and gather map does not)
purpose: Tests the behavior of combining graph- and gather maps. In this example, a blank node for each list is expected.

title: Combining graph maps and gather maps (both graph map and gather map have a template)
purpose: Tests the behavior of combining graph- and gather maps. In this example, lists are concatinated in some named graphs via blank node identifiers constructed with templates.
